body:
# HTS.cr

[![CI](https://github.com/bio-cr/hts.cr/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/bio-cr/hts.cr/actions/workflows/ci.yml)
[![Slack](http://img.shields.io/badge/slack-bio--crystal-purple?labelColor=000000&logo=slack)](https://bio-crystal.slack.com/)
[![Get invite to BioCrystal](http://img.shields.io/badge/Get_invite_to_BioCrystal-purple?labelColor=000000&logo=slack)](https://join.slack.com/t/bio-crystal/shared_invite/zt-tas46pww-JSEloonmn3Ma5eD2~VeT_g)
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/351622305.svg)](https://zenodo.org/badge/latestdoi/351622305)

HTS.cr provides [Crystal](https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal) bindings for [HTSlib](https://github.com/samtools/htslib) that allows you to read and write file formats commonly used in genomics, such as [SAM, BAM, VCF, and BCF](http://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/).

:information_source: Method names will be changed to rust-htslib style in the next version.

## Requirements

* [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org)
* [HTSlib](https://github.com/samtools/htslib)
  * Ubuntu : `apt install libhts-dev`
  * macOS  : `brew install htslib`
  * Any OS : Build from [source code](https://github.com/samtools/htslib)
  * Make sure that `pkg-config` can detect htslib: `pkg-config --libs htslib`

## Installation

Add htslib to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     htslib:
       github: bio-cr/hts.cr
       branch: develop
   ```

Run `shards install`

## Usage

Read SAM / BAM / CRAM

```crystal
require "hts/bam"

bam = HTS::Bam.open(bam_path)

bam.each do |r|
  p name: r.qname,
    flag: r.flag.value,
    chrm: r.chrom,
    strt: r.pos + 1,
    mapq: r.mapq,
    cigr: r.cigar.to_s,
    mchr: r.mate_chrom,
    mpos: r.mpos + 1,
    isiz: r.isize,
    seqs: r.seq,
    qual: r.qual_string,
    axMC: r.aux("MC")
end

bam.close
```

Read VCF / BCF

```crystal
require "hts/bcf"

bcf = HTS::Bcf.open(bcf_path)

bcf.each do |r|
  p chrom:  r.chrom,
    pos:    r.pos,
    id:     r.id,
    qual:   r.qual,
    filter: r.filter,
    ref:    r.ref,
    alt:    r.alt,
  # alleles r.alleles
  # info:   r.info,
  # format  r.format
end

bcf.close
```

## API Overview

* High level API - Classes include Bam, Bcf, Tabix, Faidx, etc.
* LibHTS - Native C bindings to HTSLib generated by [crystal_lib](https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal_lib).
* For more information, please see [API documentation](https://bio-cr.github.io/hts/).

```
 ┌──────────────────── HTS ────────────────────┐
 │                                             │
 │ ┌─ Bam ────────┬─ Bcf ───────┬─ Tabix ────┐ │
 │ │ SAM BAM CRAM │ VCF BCF     │ TABIX      │ │
 │ └──────────────┴─────────────┴────────────┘ │
 │                     ┌─LibHTS2───────────┐   │
 │ ┌─LibHTS────────────┤ Macro functions   ├─┐ │
 │ │ Native C bindings └───────────────────┘ │ │
 │ └─────────────────────────────────────────┘ │
 └─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

LibHTS2: Since methods cannot be added to `Lib` in the Crystal language, macro functions are implemented in the LibHTS2 module. This is different from Ruby-htslib.

## Looking for flexibility?

The Crystal language is suited for creating efficient command-line tools. The Ruby language, on the other hand, is suited for exploratory analysis.

* [ruby-htslib](https://github.com/kojix2/ruby-htslib)

## Contributing

:rocket: Feel free to fork it out! 

    git clone https://github.com/bio-cr/hts.cr
    cd hts.cr
    crystal run test/run_all.cr


HTS.cr is an immature, work-in-progress library, and pull requests such as small typo fixes are welcome.

    Do you need commit rights to hts?
    Do you want to get admin rights and take over the project?
    Please feel free to contact us @kojix2.

## Benchmark

https://github.com/brentp/vcf-bench

code: https://github.com/kojix2/vcf-bench/blob/kojix2/crystal-htslib/read.cr

def.body: new(file_name, mode, index, fai, threads, build_index)

def.name: open
def.body:
file = new(file_name, mode, index, fai, threads, build_index)
begin
  yield file
ensure
  file.close
end
file

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (file_name : Path | String, mode : String = "r", index = "", fai = "", threads : Int32 = 0, build_index = false)
constructors.args_html: (file_name : Path | String, mode : String = "r", index = "", fai = "", threads : Int32 = 0, build_index = false)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(file_name, mode, index, fai, threads, build_index)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: build_index
def.body:
check_closed
if index_name == ""
  STDERR.puts("Create index for #{@file_name}")
else
  STDERR.puts("Create index for #{@file_name} to #{index_name}")
end
LibHTS.sam_index_build3(@file_name, index_name, min_shift, @nthreads)

def.name: chrom
def.body:
check_closed
position = tell
ary = map do |record|
  record.chrom
end
if position.nil?
  STDERR.puts("Warning: #{@file_name} is not seekable")
else
  seek(position)
end
ary

def.name: each
def.body:
if copy
  each_record_copy do |record|
    yield record
  end
else
  each_record_reuse do |record|
    yield record
  end
end

check_closed
r = LibHTS.hts_set_fai_filename(@hts_file, fai)

def.body:
check_closed
if index_name != ""
  LibHTS.sam_index_load2(@hts_file, @file_name, index_name)
else
  LibHTS.sam_index_load3(@hts_file, @file_name, nil, 2)
end

def.name: query
def.body:
check_closed
if index_loaded?
else
  raise("Index file is required to call the query method.")
end
qiter = LibHTS.sam_itr_querys(@idx, header, region)
begin
  bam1 = LibHTS.bam_init1
  slen = LibHTS2.sam_itr_next(@hts_file, qiter, bam1)
  while slen > 0
    yield Record.new(header, bam1)
    bam1 = LibHTS.bam_init1
    slen = LibHTS2.sam_itr_next(@hts_file, qiter, bam1)
  end
ensure
  LibHTS.hts_itr_destroy(qiter)
end

def.name: write
def.body:
check_closed
r = LibHTS.sam_write1(@hts_file, header, record)
if r < 0
  raise("Failed to write record: #{record}")
end

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.
instance_methods.summary: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.

def.name: each
def.body:
@c.each do |c|
  op = LibHTS2.bam_cigar_opchr(c)
  len = LibHTS2.bam_cigar_oplen(c)
  yield({op, len})
end

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Appends a short String representation of this object
which includes its class name and its object address.

```
class Person
  def initialize(@name : String, @age : Int32)
  end
end

Person.new("John", 32).to_s # => #<Person:0x10a199f20>
```
instance_methods.summary: Appends a short String representation of this object which includes its class name and its object address.

def.name: to_s
def.body:
each do |op, len|
  io << len
  io << op
end

constants.name: TABLE
constants.value: {"paired?": LibHTS2::BAM_FPAIRED, "proper_pair?": LibHTS2::BAM_FPROPER_PAIR, "unmapped?": LibHTS2::BAM_FUNMAP, "mate_unmapped?": LibHTS2::BAM_FMUNMAP, "reverse?": LibHTS2::BAM_FREVERSE, "mate_reverse?": LibHTS2::BAM_FMREVERSE, "read1?": LibHTS2::BAM_FREAD1, "read2?": LibHTS2::BAM_FREAD2, "secondary?": LibHTS2::BAM_FSECONDARY, "qcfail?": LibHTS2::BAM_FQCFAIL, "duplicate?": LibHTS2::BAM_FDUP, "supplementary?": LibHTS2::BAM_FSUPPLEMENTARY}

def.name: aux
def.body:
ax = get_aux_pointer(str)
if ax.null?
  return nil
end
t = ax.value
case t
when 'i', 'I', 'c', 'C', 's', 'S'
  LibHTS.bam_aux2i(ax)
when 'f', 'd'
  LibHTS.bam_aux2f(ax)
when 'Z', 'H'
  String.new(LibHTS.bam_aux2_z(ax))
when 'A'
  (LibHTS.bam_aux2_a(ax)).chr
end

instance_methods.name: aux_int
instance_methods.doc: Retrun Int64
instance_methods.summary: Retrun Int64

instance_methods.name: base
instance_methods.doc: return only the base of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.
instance_methods.summary: return only the base of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.

def.name: base
def.body:
if n < 0
  n = n + self.len
end
if (n >= self.len) || (n < 0)
  return '.'
end
r = LibHTS2.bam_get_seq(@bam1)
SEQ_NT16_STR[LibHTS2.bam_seqi(r, n)]

instance_methods.name: base_qual
instance_methods.doc: return only the base quality of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.
instance_methods.summary: return only the base quality of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.

def.name: base_qual
def.body:
if n < 0
  n = n + self.len
end
if (n >= self.len) || (n < 0)
  return 0
end
q_ptr = LibHTS2.bam_get_qual(@bam1)
q_ptr[n]

instance_methods.summary: mapping quality

instance_methods.summary: returns the chromosome of the mate or '' if not mapped.

instance_methods.summary: returns 0-based mate position

instance_methods.doc: returns the tid of the mate or -1 if not mapped.
instance_methods.summary: returns the tid of the mate or -1 if not mapped.

instance_methods.summary: returns 0-based start position.

instance_methods.name: qname
instance_methods.doc: returns the query name.
instance_methods.summary: returns the query name.

instance_methods.name: qual
instance_methods.doc: return the base qualities
instance_methods.summary: return the base qualities

def.name: qual
def.body:
q_ptr = LibHTS2.bam_get_qual(@bam1)
Array.new(self.len) do |i|
  q_ptr[i]
end

def.name: qual_string
def.body:
q_ptr = LibHTS2.bam_get_qual(@bam1)
lqseq = self.len
str = String.new(lqseq) do |buffer|
  lqseq.times do |i|
    buffer[i] = q_ptr[i] + 33
  end
  {lqseq, 2}
end
str

instance_methods.name: seq
instance_methods.doc: return the read sequence
instance_methods.summary: return the read sequence

def.name: seq
def.body:
r = LibHTS2.bam_get_seq(@bam1)
String.build do |seq|
  (self.len).times do |i|
    seq << SEQ_NT16_STR[LibHTS2.bam_seqi(r, i)]
  end
end

instance_methods.name: tid
instance_methods.doc: returns the tid of the record or -1 if not mapped.
instance_methods.summary: returns the tid of the record or -1 if not mapped.

def.name: to_s
def.body:
kstr = Pointer(LibHTS::KstringT).malloc
if (LibHTS.sam_format1(@header, @bam1, kstr)) == -1
  raise("Failed to format bam record")
end
io << (String.new(kstr.value.s))

def.name: write
def.body:
check_closed
r = LibHTS.bcf_write(@hts_file, header, var_dup)
if r < 0
  raise("Failed to write record")
end

def.name: get_float
def.body:
n = Pointer(Int32).malloc
p1 = pointerof(@p1)
h = @record.header
r = @record
LibHTS.bcf_get_format_values(h, r, key, p1, n, HTS::LibHTS2::BCF_HT_REAL)
res = Pointer(Float32).new(@p1.address)
Array(Float32).new(n[0]) do |i|
  res[i]
end

res = Pointer(Int32).new(@p1.address)

  res[i]
end

def.body:
LibHTS.bcf_hdr_add_sample(@bcf_hdr, sample)
if sync
  self.sync
end

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Appends a short String representation of this object
which includes its class name and its object address.

```
class Person
  def initialize(@name : String, @age : Int32)
  end
end

Person.new("John", 32).to_s # => #<Person:0x10a199f20>
```
instance_methods.summary: Appends a short String representation of this object which includes its class name and its object address.

def.name: to_s
def.body:
kstr = LibHTS::KstringT.new
if LibHTS.bcf_hdr_format(@bcf_hdr, 0, pointerof(kstr))
else
  raise("Failed to format header")
end
io << (String.new(kstr.s))

def.name: get_flag
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header
r = @record
case LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_flag(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)
when 1
  return true
when 0
  return false
when -1
  return nil
else
  raise("unknown return value")
end

def.name: get_float
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header
r = @record
if (LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_float(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)) < 0
  return nil
end
res = Pointer(Float32).new(@p1.address)
Array(Float32).new(ndst[0]) do |i|
  res[i]
end

def.name: get_int
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header
r = @record
if (LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_int32(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)) < 0
  return nil
end
res = Pointer(Int32).new(@p1.address)
Array(Int32).new(ndst[0]) do |i|
  res[i]
end

def.name: get_string
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header
r = @record
if (LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_string(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)) < 0
  return nil
end
String.new(Pointer(UInt8).new(@p1.address))

def.name: alleles
def.body:
LibHTS.bcf_unpack(@bcf1, LibHTS2::BCF_UN_STR)
n = @bcf1.value.n_info_allele.bits(16..31)
Array(String).new(n) do |i|
  String.new(@bcf1.value.d.allele[i])
end

def.name: alt
def.body:
LibHTS.bcf_unpack(@bcf1, LibHTS2::BCF_UN_STR)
n = @bcf1.value.n_info_allele.bits(16..31)
Array(String).new(n - 1) do |i|
  String.new(@bcf1.value.d.allele[i + 1])
end

def.name: filter
def.body:
LibHTS.bcf_unpack(@bcf1, LibHTS2::BCF_UN_FLT)
d = @bcf1.value.d
n_flt = d.n_flt
case n_flt
when 0
  "PASS"
when 1
  i = d.flt.value
  String.new(LibHTS2.bcf_hdr_int2id(@header, LibHTS2::BCF_DT_ID, i))
when 2..
  Array(String).new(n_flt) do |i|
    j = d.flt[i]
    String.new(LibHTS2.bcf_hdr_int2id(@header, LibHTS2::BCF_DT_ID, j))
  end
else
  raise("unexpectd number of filters. n_flt: #{n_flt}")
end

def.name: to_s
def.body:
ksr = LibHTS::KstringT.new
if (LibHTS.vcf_format(@header, @bcf1, pointerof(ksr))) == -1
  raise("Failed to format record")
end

def.name: open
def.body:
file = new(file_name)
begin
  yield file

instance_methods.name: seq
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String | Symbol, start : Number, stop : Number)
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String | Symbol, start : Number, stop : Number)

def.name: seq
def.body:
name = name.to_s || ""
rlen = Pointer(Int32).malloc
result = LibHTS.faidx_fetch_seq(@fai, name, start, stop, rlen)
case rlen.value
when -2
  raise("Invalid chromosome name: #{name}")
when -1
  raise("Error fetching sequence: #{name}:#{start}-#{stop}")
end
String.new(result)

def.name: seq
def.body:
name = name.to_s || ""
rlen = Pointer(Int32).malloc
result = LibHTS.fai_fetch(@fai, name, rlen)
case rlen.value
when -2
  raise("Invalid chromosome name: #{name}")
when -1
  raise("Error fetching sequence: #{name}")
end
String.new(result)

def.name: file_format_version
def.body:
v = (LibHTS.hts_get_format(@hts_file)).value.version
major = v.major
minor = v.minor
if minor == -1
  "#{major}"
else
  "#{major}.#{minor}"
end

def.name: rewind
def.body:
if @start_position
  r = seek(@start_position)
  if r < 0
    raise("Failed to rewind: #{r}")
  end
  tell
else
  raise("Cannot rewind: no start position")
end

def.name: seek
def.body:
flags = @hts_file.value.flags
if ((flags & ("1000".to_i(2))) != 0)
  LibHTS.cram_seek(@hts_file.value.fp.cram, offset, IO::Seek::Set)
else
  if (  (flags & ("10000".to_i(2))) != 0)
    LibHTS.bgzf_seek(@hts_file.value.fp.bgzf, offset, IO::Seek::Set)
  else
    LibHTS.hseek(@hts_file.value.fp.hfile, offset, IO::Seek::Set)
  end
end

def.name: set_threads
def.body:
if n > 0
  r = LibHTS.hts_set_threads(@hts_file, n)
  if r < 0
    raise("Failed to set number of threads: #{n}")
  end
  @nthreads = n
end

def.name: tell
def.body:
flags = @hts_file.value.flags
if ((flags & ("1000".to_i(2))) != 0)
  nil
else
  if (  (flags & ("10000".to_i(2))) != 0)
    LibHTS2.bgzf_tell(@hts_file.value.fp.bgzf)
  else
    LibHTS2.htell(@hts_file.value.fp.hfile)
  end
end

def.name: define_getter
def.body:
def 
{{ name.id }}

        check_closed
        position = tell
        ary = map do |record|
          record.
{{ name.id }}

        
end
        if position.nil?
          STDERR.puts "Warning: #{@file_name} is not seekable"
        
else
          seek(position)
        
end
        ary
      
end

def.name: define_iterator
def.body:
def 
each_
{{ name.id }}

        check_closed
        
each do |record|
          yield record.
{{ name.id }}

        
end
        self
      
end
